==Teleri==
'''''Branda''''' is a [[Telerin]] adjective meaning "lofty, noble" or "fine". 
===Etymology===
The form in [[Primitive Elvish]] (or perhaps [[Common Telerin]]) was ''b'randâ''.<ref>{{HM|LR}}, [[The Etymologies|Etymologies]] p. 351</ref> This was apparently representing an even more primitive adjective *''barándâ'' (stem [[BARAT|BARÁD]]).
==Westron==
In [[Westron]]''',''' ''branda'' means "border, march".<ref>{{HM|AF}}</ref> 
===Etymology===
It may possibly originate from the [[Adûnaic]] *''barrad'', which has the root [[BAR]], though this is unlikely. 

==See also==
*''[[Branda-nîn]]''
*''[[Brandagamba]]'' (translated as [[Brandybuck]]) is derived from this word and the ending ''-gamba''. While a more literal translation of the name would be "Marchbuck," Tolkien instead translated it as "Brandybuck" in order to retain the visible connection with the [[Brandywine]] River.<ref>{{HM|AF}}</ref>
